div1.p: Russell writes about Carter's plans with Wade Hampton Frost and comments on the death of Adrian Stokes.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, October 3, 1927

October 3, 1927
Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I beg to acknowledge receipt of your note
of September 28th, and am glad to hear that you are
back in Washington and feeling so well. I hope that
you will be able to carry out the plans which you and
Dr. Frost have made and to bring the work to a success-
ful conclusion.

It was a shock to us to learn of the death of
Dr. Adrian Stokes. As yet we have no information aside
from that received by cable. It will be fully two weeks
more before we can receive letters from Lagos.

I shall hope to see you some time in the not
too far distant future on one of my visits to Baltimore.
I hope that you will take care of yourself and keep in good
health from now on.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell Miss Laura Carter
The Westmoreland
2122 California St., N.W.
Washington, D.C.
